message: So what are people feeling about Fabric? Kinda want a non-irc based assesment
Which fabric?  I think it's awesome, but then again I don't play with plain fabric... :-)

Feeling? Its flexibility (as in bend into funny shapes without breaking) is something I really like, even though my use cases are usually pretty simple. This largely comes from the imperative API nature of its use, I think.
Fabric does a simple thing, and does it well, exactly what all tools should aspire to. Some info on your use cases might help though.
(I'm an active patcher/user fishing)
Huh?
My use case is looking at how people like fabric, what they're doing with it, and what they want next

I recently built out our entire server pool, dev, and staging environments using fabric. I'm also using it to release, rollback, and patch code. I love it's simplicity. I do find my fabric.py script is growing to a point where it might become unmanageable. fab --list is also growing so large that it's not so useful anymore. I'd like to be able to have more control of the --list output - maybe something like being able to group commands. Aside from that, it's great!
Nope, if all you are asking is for is that the staging task set hosts and all subsequent tasks use those env vars
+1 on an easy way to group commands. Something like subcommands. $ fab nginx restart
Also maybe a way to change the context for the life of the session. $ fab host staging, would allow all future commands to run only on staging.
@seanbrant it already does that?
@seanbrant fab nginx:restart
@morganiangoose i guess i need to rtfd :) is that new?

@seanbrant Assuming my patch gets in, 1.1 will ship with module level tasks.  You could do `fab nginx.restart`.  It's all on GitHub (tswicegood/fabric), I've been using master for about a year and a half now and haven't run into any problems, but ymmv.
That is, assuming I read that right and you wanted to group a bunch of nginx commands logically together (i.e., nginx.install, nginx.restart, nginx.stop, nginx.start, etc.) in some sort of namespace.
You have any good examples for that? That you think would show well in the docs?
@tswicegood yeah thats correct. Provides a cleaner command line api.
@morganiangoose was that directed at me?  Yeah, grouping things like types of server makes a lot of sense imo
@tswicegood yeah I forget this is twitter and irc. But some snippets of the feature in use would help. Need to get docs in to pull it into my 1.1 beta dev branch
Yeah as a library you loose a lot of good work put into fab
i'm using fab almost exclusively as a library right now. It's pretty good, though there are a few odds and ends you have to manage yourself.
